column4: Hello all! Just installed Ubuntu 5.10 yesterday. Decided to get a wireless card today.
Found a tutorial to add it but it says before doing anything to add ndiswrapper-utils but I cannot find it in the Package Manager
How do I get ndiswrapper-utils if it's not in the Synaptics Package Manager?
How do I get ndiswrapper-utils if it's not in the Synaptics Package Manager?
How do I get ndiswrapper-utils if it's not in the Synaptics Package Manager?
How do I get ndiswrapper-utils if it's not in the Synaptics Package Manager?
What are your sources?
Do you have multiple apt repositories set up in /etc/apt/sources.list?
I've got the default one that comes with the install.
You will probably need to have more than just the default repositories.  Do you know how to add repositiories?
I don't know how to in synaptic because I do not use gui, but I do know how to with a text editor.
Found how to add one in synaptic...what do I need to add?
I would add the universe and the multiverse
They are actually checkboxes in synaptic so I just had to check them, reloading lists now.
I have the default and the universe and the multivers repositories and I CAN install ndiswrapper-utils
cool, that's easy then
once you have added these repositories, make sure that you update your list
Yep. just did that
Are you able to find ndiswrappers now
Cool.  Glad that I could help
Got ndiswrapper installed and followed the on-line tutorial I found but when I run 'sudo ndiswrapper -l' it doesn't say 'hardware present'
Hmm, I do not use ndiswrapper.  Someone else might have to help you with ndiswrapper.   Is there a channel specifically for ndiswrapper?
#ndiswrapper
